articles.title: Fauci plans to step down in December after half a century in government

articles.author: Vladimir Isachenkov
articles.title: Russia blames Ukraine for nationalist's car bombing death
articles.description: MOSCOW (AP) — Moving quickly to assign blame, Russia on Monday declared Ukrainian intelligence responsible for the brazen car bombing that killed the daughter of a leading right-wing Russian political thinker over the weekend.
articles.content: MOSCOW (AP) Moving quickly to assign blame, Russia on Monday declared Ukrainian intelligence responsible for the brazen car bombing that killed the daughter of a leading right-wing Russian political … [+4406 chars]

articles.author: Andy Rose, Hannah Sarisohn and Eliott C. McLaughlin, CNN
articles.title: 2 Arkansas deputies suspended and 1 officer on administrative leave after video posted of violent encounter with man outside store
articles.description: Three Arkansas law enforcement officers have been removed from duty and are under investigation, their departments confirmed, after bystander video captured at least two of them punching and kneeing a suspect during an arrest Sunday.
articles.content: (CNN)Three Arkansas law enforcement officers have been removed from duty and are under investigation, their departments confirmed, after bystander video captured at least two of them punching and kne… [+6061 chars]

articles.author: Alan Feuer
articles.title: Judge in Trump Search Case Issues Written Order Seeking Redactions
articles.description: The magistrate judge signaled that he was still inclined to release at least parts of the sealed affidavit used to justify the search of Mar-a-Lago, but he acknowledged reasons for keeping elements of it secret.
articles.content: He said there was a significant likelihood that releasing the full affidavit could harm the safety of witnesses who helped the governments investigation into whether Mr. Trump obstructed a federal in… [+973 chars]

articles.author: Megan Henry, Sheridan Hendrix, Michael Lee
articles.title: Columbus Education Association teachers carry pickets outside schools as strike begins
articles.description: Hundreds of Columbus City Schools teachers and staff formed picket lines outside some 20 school buildings Monday morning on the first day of a strike.
articles.content:
With cups of coffee in one hand and "ON STRIKE" signs in the other, hundreds of Columbus City Schools teachers and staff lined the sidewalks outside Yorktown Middle School Monday morning.

articles.author: Chris Teague
articles.title: Flooding overwhelms early morning Dallas drivers
articles.description: Drivers had to be rescued and people left homes for higher ground as heavy rains tore through Dallas early Monday morning.
articles.content: Commuters in Dallas, TX, are having a bad Monday morning. Heavy rains caused flash flooding in the area, filling the highways and overwhelming vehicles. Unfortunately, there may be more stories like … [+1594 chars]

articles.title: Appeals court puts pause on Lindsey Graham's testimony in Ga. election investigation
articles.description: A federal appeals court Sunday temporarily halted a lower court's ruling mandating Sen. Lindsey Graham, R-S.C., testify before a grand jury in Georgia.
